bill_title: prohibit institutions of higher education from discriminating against or providing preferential treatment to students.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to prohibit institutions of higher education from discriminating against or providing preferential treatment to students. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That chapter 13-53 be amended with a NEW SECTION: An institution of higher education under the control of the Board of Regents may not: (1) Grant preferential treatment to or discriminate against any student in the institution's full use, its benefits, or its services, because of a student's ancestry, color, creed, disability, national origin, race, religion, or sex; (2) Include, limit, or otherwise discriminate against any person seeking to be admitted as a student because of the person's ancestry, color, creed, disability, national origin, race, religion, or sex; (3) Discipline, dismiss, expel, include, limit, or accord preferential, adverse, or unequal treatment to, or otherwise discriminate against, any student because of the student's ancestry, color, creed, disability, national origin, race, religion, or sex; or (4) Make or use a written or oral inquiry, or form of application for admission that elicits or attempts to elicit information, or that makes or keeps a record, concerning the applicant's ancestry, color, creed, disability, national origin, race, religion, or sex, except as otherwise required by law.
